Can you put some pointers here for others reference?

issue.title: how to use .scss?
issue.body: ## I notice some websites use .scss to write css style seperately instead of putting them together in the head part. I tried to write my own css in the .scss document and added a class in the web page, but it didn't work for the web page, why is that? * VSCode

comment.body:
You need a SCSS compiler to turn the .scss into .css file.

That is beyond the scope of our basic frontend training. For quick modifications, you can try those .css files, which you use to include in your HTML header.

issue.title: clustering - Kmeans, Agglomerative, and DBSCAN
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe basic

* Which chapter of book?: Ch 17

## Describe your question

For a data set with 100 records, for all K value in 1<= K <= 100, the K-means clustering algorithm returns only one non-empty cluster. Incremental version of K-means returns exact same result. How is this possible?

And would single link and DBSCAN handle such data?

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue

For each data points with same distance to all other points clearly doesn’t work here. Besides all data points with no distance (100 of them at exact one position), is there any other possibilities?

### Have you Google/ Stackover flow anything?


Nothing found.

comment.body:
Sounds like a case where:

* Data points are too close to each other, relatively speaking, compared with the distance between centroid.
* One centroid captures all the data points at a glance and updates itself to the centre of those points; while all other centroid has no data to update themselves.

Without looking at the exact data, you can try the following methods:

# Normalise all the records, in case the distance is too small in original space.
# Manually set K-means centroid initial values. If you intend to have K clusters, randomly pick K data points to be the initial centroids.

Which algorithm is better is hard to tell without looking at the data. We can focus on making K-means work first.

issue.title: FAQ: Preview on webserver fails
issue.body:
[preview on webserver](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=yuichinukiyama.vscode-preview-server) is the suggested extension in our class. Common issues if you failed to launch preview on browser:

* Drag the entire project folder into the VSCode -- in this way, VSCode knows where to find relevant files, e.g. HTML, CSS, Javascript.
* Check if other browsers work
* Check if the workflow works without firewall (many students have ESET)
* Use `python -m SimpleHTTPServer` in Terminal and launch http://localhost:8000 -- this checks if there is any network blocker (besides regular firewall)
* Change another port for the preview server (default 8080). The method is followed.

issue.title: How to change capital letters for Mac
issue.body: At first, I created two local folders with the names of "HW1" and "HW2" but the required names should be "hw1" and "hw2"; so I changed the local folders' names and pushed online. The thing is that nothing changed online. The names of the folders are still "HW1" and "HW2". Solution: backup the files inside. delete the old "HW1" and "HW2" folders and create"hw1" and "hw2". then paste the files into the new folders.

issue.title: How to change capital letters for Mac
issue.body: At first, I created two local folders with the names of "HW1" and "HW2" but the required names should be "hw1" and "hw2"; so I changed the local folders' names and pushed online. The thing is that nothing changed online. The names of the folders are still "HW1" and "HW2". Solution: backup the files inside. delete the old "HW1" and "HW2" folders and create"hw1" and "hw2". then paste the files into the new folders.

comment.body:
Key points:

* path on MAC system is [case insensitive but case preserving](https://apple.stackexchange.com/a/22304), so `hw1` and `HW1` appears as one thing in your local disk
* path in URL scheme is **case sensitive**, so `xxx.github.io/hw1` and `xxx.github.io/HW1` are two different locations.

issue.title: The element is not flexible  with the browse shaping.
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

* IDE (e.g. VSCode):VSCode
* Browser (Chrome/ Safari/ Firefox/ VSCode Embedded):Chrome
* The link to your issue pages hosted on gh-pages (`xxx.github.io/page.html`): Ly-Iris.github.io/hw2/


<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that are irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question

I used the (div class="card") and (div class="avatar") function in my code, but when I shape my browser, the elements "card" and "avatar" do not move together.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue

I have searched online and viewed many videos.

### Have you Google or StackOverflow?

Yes.

### Do they solve or partially solve your question?

No.

### What is the closest answer you can find?

It is suggested that I should use the @media function, but I don't think it's related to this tag.

issue.title: The element is not flexible  with the browse shaping.
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

* IDE (e.g. VSCode):VSCode
* Browser (Chrome/ Safari/ Firefox/ VSCode Embedded):Chrome
* The link to your issue pages hosted on gh-pages (`xxx.github.io/page.html`): Ly-Iris.github.io/hw2/


<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that are irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question

I used the (div class="card") and (div class="avatar") function in my code, but when I shape my browser, the elements "card" and "avatar" do not move together.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue

I have searched online and viewed many videos.

### Have you Google or StackOverflow?

Yes.

### Do they solve or partially solve your question?

No.

### What is the closest answer you can find?

It is suggested that I should use the @media function, but I don't think it's related to this tag.

comment.body:
@Ly-Iris ! Let's conclude a few key points here:

* Spacing can be done by margin/ border/ padding/ innerHTML size. -- Use them according to the meaning, instead of according to how they appears on the browser screen (all could be blank-space).
* Center an element: margin-left auto; margin-right auto.
* `position: absolute` can be used to place an element out of regular "flow". "flow" means top-to-bottom and left-to-right.
* In order to make `position: absolute` work as expected, its parent element needs to be `relative`. Or it will recursively track back towards the root until one `relative` is found.

issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

* IDE (e.g. VSCode):VSCode
* Browser (Chrome/ Safari/ Firefox/ VSCode Embedded):Chrome
* The link to your issue pages hosted on gh-pages (`xxx.github.io/page.html`): Ly-Iris.github.io/hw2/


<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that are irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question

I used the (div class="card") and (div class="avatar") function in my code, but when I shape my browser, the elements "card" and "avatar" do not move together.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue

I have searched online and viewed many videos.

### Have you Google or StackOverflow?

Yes.

### Do they solve or partially solve your question?

No.

### What is the closest answer you can find?

It is suggested that I should use the @media function, but I don't think it's related to this tag.

comment.body: Short take is that you usually do not use margin/ padding to *layout* objects. Current: Use `position: absolute` and place the element w.r.t. its parent: effect of sizing: There are other details that we can discuss f2f.

issue.title: fail to sync browser if there is no body tag
issue.body:
I have been using this extension for around two years.. It worked very well, until I try to do some "quick test" today. I omitted `head` and `body` since most modern browsers can work with that. It confused me some time when the `vscode-preview-server` extension does not refresh page upon save. Then I found running `browser-sync` from the command line also does not work (browser-sync server work; but page does not refresh). After some trial and error, I find the issue... For example, following works: (refresh upon save) ```

test sync

``` Following does not work. ```

test sync

``` It seems the `browser-sync` tool tries to find body and inject codes. I didn't notice that before. This is not an issue of this extension but hope the record here can help others in similar situations.

comment.body: I’m not sure about the necessity. I don’t have strong preference because HTML needs to have body tag anyway, except for quick testing :). If we want to help others who overlook this, we can insert either at the body begin, or end of the entire document if there is no body tag.

issue.title: how to jump to next page in centaline property
issue.body: # Troubleshooting ## Describe your environment * Operating system: ios * Python version: 3.0 * Hardware: * Internet access: * Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y * Which chapter of book?: ch7 ## Describe your question Cannot jump to the next page in [centaline property](http://hk.centanet.com/findproperty/zh-HK/Home/SearchResult?posttype=S&src=F), attached with the pageing source. ## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue The URL of different pages doesn't change, also I tried to treat the '下一頁' as a button and try to click but failed. ## click as a button python: ``` data = [] while True: try: loadMoreButton = browser.find_element_by_class_name("pagingNext pagingA") time.sleep(2) loadMoreButton.click() time.sleep(5) except Exception as e: print(e) break data.extend(get_articles_from_browser()) print("Complete") # time.sleep(10) browser.quit() ```

comment.body: can you print the “loadMoreButton”? See if the element is correctly located and selected.
